conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I can help you with rice storage tips.

• Store cooked rice in an airtight container in the refrigerator. It will last for 2-3 days.

• Ensure the rice cools down before refrigerating to prevent moisture buildup.

• You can also freeze cooked rice for longer storage (up to 1 month).

• Recipe to prevent waste: Egg Fried Rice (approx. 30 BDT). This is a quick way to use leftover rice with readily available ingredients.

Reducing food waste helps lower greenhouse gas emissions from landfills.

Next step: Refrigerate your rice properly to extend its shelf life.

Okay! Here are some vegetable options to boost your nutrition:

• Focus on leafy green vegetables like spinach and red amaranth (lal shak) for essential vitamins and minerals.

• Spinach (20 BDT/bundle) is rich in iron, while red amaranth (15 BDT/bundle) provides vitamin C and antioxidants.

• These vegetables contribute to overall health and well-being.

Next step: Incorporate spinach or red amaranth into your next meal for a nutritional boost.
